name: Cobton-on-the-Shiver
tagline: A thriving village of Cobbins, ruled by cruel crookhorn ruffians
description: An idyllic-seeming village situated at a bend in the River Shiver, in the Valley of Wise Beasts. Most of the buildings in the village are quaint little houses of wood, half human size, with charmingly carved and painted gables. Mingled among them are a number of treehouses, stilt-houses (beside the river), and a few larger buildings of stone (located around the village square).
atmosphere: Upon first impression, all in Cobton seems well. Animals merrily go about their business, fishing, sailing little boats, making and mending, smoking pipes and drinking tea. In truth, however, the inhabitants of the Valley live under the totalitarian rule of the crookhorn Baron Fragglehorn and his band of ruffians.
inhabitants_description: Talking, humanoid animals who call themselves Cobbins, 2′–3′ tall, dressed in dapper woollens and tweed. Many species of Cobbins live in Cobton including badgers, foxes, hares, moles, mice, otters, rabbits, rats, squirrels, toads, water voles, and weasels.

governance.notes: The village is within the dominion of Atanuwë, under the totalitarian rule of the crookhorn Baron Fragglehorn and his band of ruffians from his tower in hex 1004.

religion.religious_practices: Daily communal worship of the Nag-Lord is enforced. Every evening, the whole village gathers at the church for forced communal hymns and prayer.
religion.notes: The animals of Cobton worship Atanuwë as lord of all creation. The villagers refer to their master as the Nag-Lord, not knowing of its other names.

history: Atanuwë decided it needed servitors and worshippers upon taking up lordship of the abandoned reaches of northern Dolmenwood
It created the crookhorns to do its bidding in war, but also saw fit to awaken sentience in the woodland animals of the nearby valley
Cobton was built upon the ruins of a human settlement which had lain derelict and overgrown for untold centuries
Atanuwë tasked the newly awakened Cobbins with clearing the ruins and building a village for their own kind there, in mockery of the proud creations of humankind
current_events: Daily communal worship of the Nag-Lord is enforced, and it is illegal (on pain of death!) for any Cobbin to leave the Valley
While the majority of Cobbins simply wish to lead a quiet life and stay out of trouble, a rebellion is brewing—the Grey League
After a recent backlash, the Grey League is reduced to three mice, a badger, and two water voles, in addition to their leader, Wallobry Trundlehorn

special_features.name: Illegal to Bear Arms
special_features.description: The bearing of anything more threatening than a dagger or a stout staff is banned in Cobton
special_features.mechanical_effect: Transgressors quickly attract the attentions of the crookhorn guards

special_features.name: Reaction to Outsiders
special_features.description: Visitors from beyond the Valley are a once-in-a-lifetime event for the residents of Cobton
special_features.mechanical_effect: Strangers rapidly come to the attention of the crookhorn village guard, who try to imprison or expel them

special_items: All items for sale in Cobton are sized for Cobbins—approximately half human size
equipment_availability.notes: Weapons larger than a dagger are not available (except in secret, to trusted friends of the smith). Mounts and armour cannot be bought in Cobton.

locations.name: The King's Head
locations.description: A human-height ground floor of ancient stone, augmented with a miniature upper floor in red-varnished wood. The King's Head is the social nexus of the village.
locations.interior: Cheery and spotlessly clean. Miniature (half human size) tables are decked with embroidered tablecloths and lace doilies, and ringed with dainty stools carved with sylvan scenes. Little cast iron lanterns hang from the human-height (8′) ceiling, lending a warm, flickering glow to the space. Rocking chairs with cosy cushions stand in the corners.
locations.exterior: A portrait of Atanuwë, depicted (as is traditional in the Valley) with white fur, purple horn, pink mane, a toothy smirk, and seven eyes in a row.
locations.populace: Cobbins of all species, drinking, singing, and dancing upon tables. Crookhorn guards poke their heads in periodically.
locations.atmosphere: Social nexus of the village with warm, flickering atmosphere

services.name: Lodging
services.description: Common quality, only Cobbin-sized beds available
services.notes: Medium characters may be offered a cramped space in the common room

services.name: Shiverston ale
services.description: The only drink served is the local brew—a golden ale with a smooth texture and a hint of honey

special_features: No stabling - the inn has no stable, and the village no facilities for handling large mounts

locations.name: Village Square and Docks
locations.description: A neat cobbled square beside the river, with a set of small piers and moorings.
locations.exterior: Hanging ominously in the middle of the square are the rotting corpses of three hares (erstwhile members of the Grey League).
locations.populace: Once a week—on Frisk—Cobbins from throughout the Valley gather here to sell their wares and produce.
locations.atmosphere: Ominous due to the gallows, but bustling on market day

services.name: Boat travel
services.description: Passage on a boat to hexes 1004 or 1203
services.notes: Mounts and vehicles cannot be handled. The journey takes 1½ hours to 1004 and 2 hours to 1203.

locations.name: Guardhouse and Gaol
locations.description: An old stone house of human dimensions, extended with a wooden lookout tower and used as the village guard's base of operations.
locations.interior: 12 crookhorns are barracked here, along with the guard captain Briggsy Bugber. 2d6 of them are present at any given time, while the rest patrol the village.
locations.exterior: Old stone house with wooden lookout tower extension
special_features: Prisoner: A rat named Hackle Kingsley is currently in the gaol, awaiting trial for the crime of attempting to leave the Valley

locations.name: The Shiverston Brewery
locations.description: A long, low building of black-glazed bricks, alive with the sounds of cheery industry.
locations.interior: Cellars where the Grey League holds their candlelit meetings
locations.exterior: Long, low building of black-glazed bricks
locations.atmosphere: Industrial but with secret resistance activity
special_features: Secret meetings: Of late, the Grey League has held their candlelit meetings in the cellars of the brewery

locations.name: Village Church
locations.description: A wee, human-sized chapel repurposed as a Cobbin-sized church praising the Nag-Lord. The walls are of pebble-dashed stucco and a wicker unicorn is perched atop the pointed roof.
locations.interior: Polished river stones serve as seats. A gaudily painted clay effigy of the Nag-Lord stands upon a 4′ high altar. A holy unicorn horn (actually a painted piece of carved wood) hangs by a chain from the ceiling.
locations.exterior: Pebble-dashed stucco walls with a wicker unicorn perched atop the pointed roof
locations.populace: Cobbins cower before the effigy of their lord, praying for mercy. Every evening, the whole village gathers at the church for (forced) communal hymns and prayer.
locations.atmosphere: Oppressive religious fear and forced worship
special_features: Briggsy Bugber acts as priest, bearing a viciously spiked ceremonial mace and wearing a cloak studded with hundreds of horns

locations.name: The Smithy
locations.description: The village's smithy is dug into the banks of the eastern side of the river, its location signified by a tall brick chimney emerging from the grass.
locations.exterior: Tall brick chimney emerging from grass, entrance from riverside dock or back door

services.name: Smithing
services.description: Cares for the village's supplies in pots, pans, and tools

services.name: Illegal weapons
services.description: Illegally manufactures weapons for the Grey League in secret
services.notes: Only for trusted Grey League members

special_features: Secret weapon manufacturing for Grey League
secrets: Manufactures illegal weapons for the resistance

locations.name: Toad's Hole
locations.description: A round door and windows in a little knoll, bordered by well-tended herb gardens and a wicker fence. The village herbalist does nothing to advertise the presence of his business, but is known to all locals.
locations.interior: A series of cosy subterranean chambers with rounded doors, walls, and ceilings (6′ tall at their highest point). Shelves stacked with textbooks, notebooks, and jars of ointment line the walls. Bundles of drying herbs hang beside fireplaces.
locations.exterior: A plain wooden door with a brass plaque: 'Dr. Simeone Fisher—all who ail are welcome.'

services.name: Mushrooms and herbs
services.description: The preparations listed in the Dolmenwood Player's Book

services.name: Infirmary
services.notes: Ailments are cured after half the normal duration and there is a 1-in-4 chance of magical diseases being healed after 2d6 days. The cost of any specific herbs required is extra.

locations.name: Water Mill
locations.description: An imposing stone building of human dimensions with a granary tower at the rear. The lapping of the mill wheel and the grinding of the stone are ceaseless—the place produces sack after sack of fine, white flour.
locations.interior: Mill workspace with secret door in cellar leading to harpy's lair - a suite of plushly decorated boudoirs and bedchambers, where the light of hypnotically flickering purple lanterns reflects off dozens of mirrors
locations.exterior: Imposing stone building with granary tower
locations.populace: The mouse millers (husband and wife) and their four children
locations.atmosphere: Industrial but with sinister undertones due to harpy influence
special_features: Mouse informants: Every evening, the miller mice go below and tell the harpy of all that they saw and heard that day
secrets: Harpy in the cellar: Old Madame Whipthorn lives secreted in the cellar as a spy for Atanuwë

locations.name: Dobbledown Tea Rooms
locations.description: A little white-walled farmhouse with a thatched roof, sitting at the edge of several acres of arable.
locations.interior: The front room and kitchen of the farm now serve as a public tea room, with little rickety tables and chairs situated around a circular, green rug embroidered with the smiling cow.
locations.exterior: A smiling cow wearing a chef's hat (sign)
locations.populace: The owner, a twitchy squirrel named Nathaniel Nutkin, scurries between tables serving guests

services.name: Tea and scones
services.description: A pot of tea with creamy milk

services.name: Full cream tea
services.description: Tea with scones, butter, clotted cream, and blackberry jam

locations.name: River Path
locations.description: A little footpath (not suitable for large mounts or vehicles) that winds along the northern bank of the River Shiver, leading from Baron Fragglehorn's tower (hex 1004) to Longshanks Falls (hex 1203).
special_features: Not suitable for large mounts or vehicles

npcs.name: Wallobry Trundlehorn
npcs.title: Grey League Leader
npcs.description: An old mole lady with twinkling eyes and a grey patch on her head
npcs.dress: Dresses in ill-fitting woollens and a floppy, floral hat
npcs.mannerisms: Looks at the ground when speaking
desires: All crookhorns expelled from the Valley
To marry the innkeeper, Smunkey O'Brady

known_topics.content: Wallobry mumbles, looking at the ground. 'The crookhorns... they control everything. We cannot leave the Valley. We must worship the Nag-Lord. It is... difficult.'
She tugs at her floppy hat nervously. 'The Cobbins just want to live in peace. Fish, sail boats, make and mend. But the crookhorns... they make everything hard.'

secret_info.content: Her twinkling eyes grow serious. 'I lead the Grey League—what remains of us. Three mice, a badger, two water voles, and myself. We resist the crookhorns in secret. Our meetings are held in the cellars of the Shiverston Brewery.'
secret_info.hint: She seems unusually interested in the political situation for such a timid mole.

secret_info.content: She blushes beneath her grey fur. 'I wish to marry Smunkey O'Brady, the innkeeper. But with the crookhorns watching everything... it is hard to speak of such things.'
secret_info.hint: She grows flustered whenever the innkeeper is mentioned.

relationships.description: Secretly wishes to marry the innkeeper
relationships.notes: Both are sympathetic to the resistance

relationships.description: The smith manufactures weapons for the Grey League in secret
relationships.notes: Provides illegal weapons to the resistance

npcs.name: Smunkey O'Brady
npcs.title: King's Head Proprietor
npcs.description: A tan male hare, with one bent ear
npcs.dress: Dresses in red and white polka dot pantaloons with a black apron
npcs.mannerisms: Tugs on his bent ear when thinking
desires: For Cobton to be freed from slavery
To sail upon the mythical Lake Longmere
secrets: Knows of the Grey League and has contacts
Knows that Baron Fragglehorn is afraid of snakes

known_topics.content: Smunkey tugs his bent ear thoughtfully. 'The King's Head offers lodging at standard price—though only Cobbin-sized beds, I'm afraid. Shiverston ale costs one silver a mug. Golden, smooth, hint of honey!'
He leans in conspiratorially. 'We Cobbins were awakened by the Nag-Lord—given sentience. But now we're trapped here, forced to worship. It's not right.'
His eyes grow wistful. 'I dream of sailing upon the mythical Lake Longmere. They say it lies beyond the Valley... but we cannot leave.'

secret_info.content: He whispers excitedly. 'I know of the Grey League and have contacts among them. If you wish to help free Cobton from slavery... we should talk privately.'
secret_info.hint: He seems unusually interested in outsiders who question crookhorn authority.

secret_info.content: He grins mischievously. 'I know something useful: Baron Fragglehorn is afraid of snakes! Terrified of them. Could be useful, yes?'
secret_info.hint: He seems to know more about the Baron than most Cobbins.

relationships.description: The Grey League leader wishes to marry him

npcs.name: Briggsy Bugber
npcs.title: Crookhorn Guard Captain
npcs.description: A red-furred, hunch-backed crookhorn woman with frenzied, staring eyes and a single, spiralling horn in the centre of her forehead (regarded as highly auspicious)
npcs.dress: Wears a chainmail hauberk daubed with blood
desires: To serve in battle under Captain Snarkscorn—bored of her post in Cobton

known_topics.content: Briggsy brays dictatorially. 'I am guard captain of Cobton. Twelve crookhorns under my command. The law is simple: no weapons larger than a dagger, no leaving the Valley, and daily worship of the Nag-Lord!'
She brandishes her spiked ceremonial mace. 'Every evening, the whole village gathers at the church for hymns and prayer. I lead the service myself. Attendance is... mandatory.'

secret_info.content: Her frenzied eyes soften momentarily. 'I wish to serve in battle under Captain Snarkscorn. I am bored of this peaceful village—there are so few opportunities to exercise my... talents.'
secret_info.hint: She seems restless and frustrated with garrison duty.

relationships.description: Consults with the harpy spy at night
relationships.notes: Slips into the mill's back door to meet with Whipthorn

relationships.description: Serves Baron Fragglehorn from his tower in hex 1004

npcs.name: Doctor Simeone Fisher
npcs.title: Herbalist
npcs.description: An elderly male toad with dark blue skin and unusual pale violet eyes
npcs.dress: Dresses in pristine, medical whites, with little spectacles perched upon his nose
desires: To cure the crookhorns of their maladies (believing their evil nature to be a product of their sickness)

known_topics.content: Doctor Fisher rumbles and burps. 'I am the village herbalist. Mushrooms and herbs at standard prices. Infirmary care costs five gold per day—ailments cured in half the normal time.'
His pale violet eyes gleam. 'I seek rare herbs and mushrooms from beyond the Valley. If you have traveled far, perhaps you carry something... unusual?'

secret_info.content: The old toad sighs deeply. 'I believe the crookhorns' evil nature is a product of their sickness—some malady of body or spirit. If I could find the right cure... perhaps they could be healed, and Cobton freed without bloodshed.'
secret_info.hint: He treats injured crookhorns with unusual compassion.

npcs.name: Fosbry Hollowhop
npcs.title: Smith
npcs.description: A middle-aged male fox with grizzled fur and an eye patch
npcs.dress: Dresses in scorched leathers and always carries a flask of strong spirits in his belt
desires: To be the wealthiest Cobbin in the Valley—and leader of Cobton—if the crookhorn regime is deposed

known_topics.content: Fosbry speaks eloquently, meandering between topics. 'The smithy provides pots, pans, tools—all the necessities. Standard prices. We're dug into the riverbank, so watch your head.'
He takes a swig from his flask. 'I remain carefully neutral, politically. The crookhorns leave me alone, and I leave them alone. It's simpler that way.'

secret_info.content: He glances around, then whispers. 'In secret, I manufacture weapons for the Grey League. Ten times the normal price, of course. Only for trusted friends of the resistance.'
secret_info.hint: He seems unusually prosperous for a simple village smith.

secret_info.content: His one good eye gleams. 'If the crookhorn regime is ever deposed, I intend to be the wealthiest Cobbin in the Valley—and leader of Cobton. Someone must guide the village into a new era.'
secret_info.hint: He speaks of a post-crookhorn future with unusual confidence.

relationships.description: Manufactures weapons for the Grey League in secret

npcs.name: Old Madame Whipthorn
npcs.title: Harpy
npcs.description: A bent, warty, pallid-skinned crone with staring red eyes and the legs, tail, and wings of a great crow. Scrawny, 3-jointed arms emerge from her shoulders, below the wings. On her head is a luxuriant cascade of blonde curls
npcs.speech: The beautiful, clear voice of a young noblewoman
desires: To eat the flesh of magicians
To bear an Atacorn—a spawn of the Nag-Lord
secrets: A charmed willow stick (Wand of Phantasm with 12 charges)

known_topics.content: Old Madame Whipthorn speaks with the beautiful, clear voice of a young noblewoman. 'I am but a humble resident of this village. The miller family has been... most hospitable.'
She preens her luxuriant blonde curls. 'The Nag-Lord is lord of all creation. We are blessed to serve such a magnificent being.'

secret_info.content: Her red eyes gleam with cunning. 'I serve the Nag-Lord as his eyes and ears in Cobton. Every evening, the miller mice tell me all they saw and heard. Nothing escapes my notice.'
secret_info.hint: The miller family seems strangely devoted to her.

secret_info.content: She sighs wistfully. 'My deepest desire is to bear an Atacorn—a spawn of the Nag-Lord himself. To be mother to such a creature would be... glorious.'
secret_info.hint: She speaks of the Nag-Lord with unusual devotion.

secret_info.content: She strokes a charmed willow stick—a Wand of Phantasm with twelve charges. Her pearl brooch alone is worth fifteen hundred gold, her earrings six hundred each.
secret_info.hint: She adorns herself with surprisingly valuable pearls.

relationships.description: The guard captain consults with her at night
relationships.notes: Briggsy slips into the mill to receive intelligence

entries.description: 2 moles flounder in the river, their boat capsized
One of the mouse millers (see the Water Mill) with a glazed expression, gazing into empty space
2d3 crookhorn guards round up everyone in the village to the church to celebrate the Nag-Lord's birthday (of which there are several per year)
The public hanging of the rat Hackle Kingsley, who has been lingering in the gaol for some months
1d4 crookhorn guards drag a yelping rabbit—caught with a knife longer than the permitted 6″—to the gaol
1d3 heretical mice remove the hanged hares from the village square and replace them with unicorn effigies
Briggsy Bugber slipping into the mill's back door to consult with Old Madame Whipthorn
Loud cheers and merry singing drift from the Dobbledown Tea Rooms—a birthday party
1d4 crookhorn guards enforcing an impromptu curfew
Briggsy Bugber and 2d4 crookhorn guards march through the streets to welcome a visiting party including Baron Fragglehorn himself
Wallobry Trundlehorn sneaking round the back of the Shiverston Brewery for a secret meeting of the Grey League

monsters.name: Briggsy Bugber
monsters.description: A red-furred, hunch-backed crookhorn woman with frenzied, staring eyes and a single, spiralling horn in the centre of her forehead

special_abilities.name: Disease
special_abilities.description: Anyone bitten or butted by Briggsy must Save Versus Doom or be afflicted by a nasty infection (see crookhorn—DMB)

monsters.name: Old Madame Whipthorn
monsters.description: A bent, warty, pallid-skinned crone with staring red eyes and the legs, tail, and wings of a great crow. Scrawny, 3-jointed arms emerge from her shoulders, below the wings. On her head is a luxuriant cascade of blonde curls. She adorns herself with pearls.

special_abilities.name: Possessions
special_abilities.description: A charred willow stick (Wand of Phantasm with 12 charges). Pearl brooch (1,500gp) and earrings (600gp each).
